summary: This document outlines the revocation and termination of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One by Jeffrey E. Epstein. It details the roles of the trustees and the legal authority under which Epstein executed the termination of the trust, returning all assets to himself.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the Grantor who initiated the revocation and termination of the trust he created.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is one of the current trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One.

persons.name: Andrew Farkas
persons.context: Andrew Farkas is another trustee of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley was named as a trustee in the Amended and Restated Trust Agreement but did not execute the agreement.

persons.name: Harry I. Beller
persons.context: Harry I. Beller is the notary public who acknowledged the execution of the revocation and termination document.

connections.description: Darren K. Indyke serves as a trustee for the trust established by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Andrew Farkas is also a trustee for the trust established by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Darren K. Indyke and Andrew Farkas are co-trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One.
Jes Staley was named as a trustee but did not execute the Amended and Restated Trust Agreement.

events.title: Revocation and Termination of Trust
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executed a document to revoke and terminate The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One.

keyFacts: The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One was created on November 8, 2001.
The trust was amended and restated on January 27, 2012.
Darren K. Indyke and Andrew Farkas are the current trustees, while Jes Staley did not execute the amended trust agreement.
Jeffrey E. Epstein reserved the right to revoke and terminate the trust.
The document was notarized by Harry I. Beller.
